title: Dandy Caramel Candies
directions: Butter a 13-in. x 9-in. pan with 1-1/2 teaspoons butter; set aside. In a heavy saucepan, combine the sugars, corn syrup, butter and cream.

Bring to a boil over medium-high heat, stirring constantly. Cook over medium heat until a candy thermometer reads 248Â° (firm-ball stage). Remove from the heat; stir in pecans and vanilla. Quickly spread into prepared pan. Cool.
Cut into 1-in. squares. Place squares on waxed paper-lined baking sheets; chill thoroughly. Dip each candy into melted candy coating. Refrigerate until firm. Yield: about 9 dozen.
ingredients: Dark or milk chocolate candy coating, melted
